column4: how can i setup 3g usb modem to connect to internet in ubuntu server 12.04.
how can i setup 3g usb modem to connect to internet in ubuntu server 12.04. can any one help me?
Are there any Linux drivers for that specific modem?
Could you post a pastebin of the output of the command 'lsusb'.
Please use pastebin or paste.ubuntu.com. Do not post your output here.
Go to pastebin.com, paste the output there, give it a life of an hour or so, and submit it and send teh link over here.
There may be applications that can put things into pastebin but pastebin is a web service entirly different from Ubuntu like Google.
It's easier just to copy paste it to pastebin.com. If you still want to learn how to install things from the terminal just ask.
Use paste.ubuntu.com then
i just paste it to paste.ubuntu.com the lsusb output
Bus 001 Device 003: ID 1c9e:9605 OMEGA TECHNOLOGY   <-- This is your modem?
Try this: http://askubuntu.com/questions/126854/problem-connecting-internet-through-usb-modem-micromax
The desktop and server versions are very similar. It more than probably applies to both.
You'll have to do wtihout it and test your connection in other ways.
i'm new to linux. i don't know how to do that other way.
Use 'ping apache.org' to test your connection.
how do i configure APN etc to connect to
That depends on the software that came with it. I think your best bet is to look up how to configure that exact product with Ubuntu servers
there is no software available from vendor for linux. do u guide me the way?
I don't know, I'm unsure about vendor specific stuff. I'd give you a push in the right direction but it would be against the rules.
thank you!
